And also, where they find themselves the somewhat-captive but very intrigued peanut gallery to the lives of both Cliopher Mdang and His Radiancy the Emperor.

title: Obscure Regional Legalities
author: rattyjol
summary:
“I,” Jullanar said, lifting her chin high, the stone pillar under her hands warm from the sun, “am Jullanar of the Sea.”

Down below, where she could see beads of sweat beginning to form on his brow, her husband—soon to be ex—let out a strained, disbelieving laugh.

“Don’t be absurd, Jules.” And that would be the last time she would bear that loathed nickname. “I know you—”

“I am increasingly beginning to doubt it.”

She could see the embarrassment beginning to give way to anger in his stance and in his terrier daemon’s flattened ears, and felt a savage thrill at the flush creeping up his neck. Good, let him steam.

title: The Poet and the Sailor
author: rattyjol
summary:
Once, when he was young, the poet descended the stairs of the tower and tried to open the door that he found there. The magic within it had howled his own fear right back at him, and he had gone back up the stairs and never ventured down them again.

Now that remembered fear is like a sigh, the merest wisp next to the freedom roaring in his ears. He does not know what it means, that the Empire has fallen, only that it has. The sprites in the tower, too, have been freed, and it is empty like a cavern is empty, a yawning, echoing, horrible place. The poet suspects it has always been that way, and the stillness is only allowing him to see it with fresh eyes.

He says aloud, “I am leaving.”

title: Join, Rejoinder
author: rattyjol
summary:
They were waiting to greet him in the tower, his mother and grandmother and Leona, and even Uncle Kip—he was Uncle Kip here, undoubtedly, dressed in shabby linen tunic and sarong and looking thoroughly Islander, thoroughly relaxed. Gaudy felt a strange sense of vertigo, looking at him, with the layers of court robes heavy on his own shoulders and a sailor shouting in a Solaaran accent behind him. Then the moment stretched and snapped, and a wave of rightness washed over him. Home again.

Saya Kalikiri had had an odd twinkle in her eye when she granted him this sudden holiday, unasked for, and handed him a stack of dispatch cases taller than he was to work through on the trip out. He was to have a week's holiday in the Vangavaye-ve, and no work to do on the journey back, so he certainly couldn't complain. He saw that same twinkle now in the eyes of his family as they greeted him, and was confirmed in his suspicions that the trip was for more than a job well done.

title: you are written in the stars that we are swimming in
author: whenstarsignite
summary:
“Oh, Pali, it’s beautiful.” She felt lighter than she had in days.

“It is.” Pali gave her hand a fierce squeeze. When Jullanar looked over, Pali was turning her head back to the water. The air was chilly, and Jullanar was certain that the water would be colder than she’d like it to be, but Pali’s hand was warm and Jullanar’s heart was like an ember glowing after a blaze.

“Not quite the Sea of Stars but it’s very close, don’t you think?”

title: The Wanderer, Found
author: rattyjol
summary:
She had been thinking about settling down. She had always talked about a nebulous someday, when she might have children and a cat and a little shop called Elderflower Books. Sometime in the last year or two, without her notice, it had slipped from someday to any day now.

Maybe it was Damian and Pharia who had put the idea in her head, with all their talk of taking their little children and going to live in Astandalas, beneath the very nose of the Emperor. A final jab, a fitting retirement.

Well, anyway. Someday had been left too late.

The spark smoulders gently, flickers, catches.

“I think,” Kip says firmly, warmly, “that we can do a little better than that.”

summary:
Kip Mdang returns to Solaara, hardly confident that the Imperial Service will take him back but sure that there is no place for him in the Vangavaye-ve.

The City of Cities is still expanding from the backwater village it was before the Fall; the work of reconstruction continues but it is no longer a simple crisis. In the Palace the big political beasts are circling for position under the newly awakened Emperor.

Despondent and determined to bury himself in work, Cliopher finds his former patron disapproving and the new Master of Offices openly hostile. But he is still a fifth degree secretary, and some problems are easier to solve when you feel that you have little left to lose... and don't care which enemies you make along the way.

title: None of them is without meaning
author: elīkabeha (Ollyver)
summary:
Artorin Damara was not as ignorant of the common tongue as his priests believed.

Childhood punishments of memorising dead languages had given him a keen understanding of comparative linguistics, and he'd since had contact with magic both wild and divine. Hemmed in by politics and taboo, he kept his own counsel. He eavesdropped on his court with impunity, inventing epic stories from overheard gossip. But he had not had a conversation with a friend in all the years since he was crowned Emperor.

Then Cliopher Mdang was appointed his secretary.

title: The Situation
author: alfgifu
summary:
Hiscaron is happy as a Palace Guard. His chief ambitions are - or were - to do his bit to keep the Imperial household safe, to figure out whodunnit before getting to the end of the latest detective novel he's reading, and perhaps one day to be promoted to inner guard. Minimum drama, minimum fuss, maximum standing about with well-oiled muscles on display in front of potential paramours.

The Emperor's new secretary is not cooperating with this career plan.

(All fics in this series build out from events in Embers - and therefore spoil it - but I've tried to keep them viable as stand-alones too.)

title: Be My Breath Through The Deep Deep Water
author: toffeecape
summary:
Kip was reading, or trying to read, to distract himself from his self-pity and the silence of the Palace all but emptied for Silverheart, when the earthquake hit and he was plunged into unfathomable darkness.

Unfathomable, but not entirely unfamiliar. He was reminded of the time the rip current caught him, when he was twelve years old and trying to dive for a flame pearl against Buru Tovo's better judgment. Now, as then, he scrabbled for a grip on something, anything, as the darkness and the cold and the pressure intensified as he was swept down and down.

Now, as then, he did slam against something eventually, but this time it wasn't a rock.

It was another person.

Only, his restful morning is not as it seems and the dreams begin to pile up.

title: How not to stay out of the snake pit
author: alfgifu
summary:
“Well,” said Viorin, “you heard about the latest Imperial Secretary, right?”

Emilia groaned “What happened to this one?” The short and calamitous careers of the various unfortunate souls sent up to trial as secretaries to the Glorious One was a running - and not at all funny - joke across the Palace.

Viorin grinned at her. “You are out of the loop! This one’s made it stick, somehow,” she said, “he’s been there for months now, and he’s working with the Dragon on a total reform of all the Ministries, with the Emperor’s support, and word has it that the Ouranatha are out on their ears, and General Ravillon’s retiring, and they ordered Merry’s arrest.”

(All fics in this series build out from events in Embers - and therefore spoil it - but I've tried to keep them viable as stand-alones too.)

title: Signals
author: Penguinity
summary:
Kiri cleared her throat, and the secretaries looked up as one. She waved the letters in one hand. “The stack in the second pigeonhole, what sort of letters are these?”

“The ones from people who aren’t crackpots, but don’t need help from our office.”

Cliopher nodded, satisfied. “Indeed, well-sorted.”

Kiri held up a finger to silence him. “And?”

There was a brief pause, before Gaudy gave an almost inaudible sigh and answered. “And who are flirting with Lord Mdang.”

title: All the ashes in my wake
author: Marayanna
summary:
He was returning to this day even long centuries later. Was it his fault? Did he move unexpectedly, impatiently, heedless of the etiquette he scorned so much? Or was he just lost in thought and his movement unthinking, careless? Or was it the woman who made the mistake and for one, terrible moment touched the Emperor’s skin?

But no matter how long he spend thinking about that day, the cruel truth of the matter was that he didn’t pay attention to anything and anyone - that he was so wrapped up in his own suffering, he didn’t even notice anything had gone wrong.

Until she started screaming.

The imperial taboo against touching was the strongest of all.

title: Tenebra, or The Crow
author: alfgifu
summary:
It was highly inconvenient to find myself transformed into a crow in the Imperial Apartments, and somewhat alarming when I discovered that I could not access my magic, and therefore could not turn back.

...

The small room was empty, and dark. A single patch of silvery moonlight picked out a fluffy piece of fabric draped over the back of the long couch.

Cliopher stared for a long moment, then became aware of movement by his feet. He looked down. The large black crow had landed beside him in a splatter of ink, and was regarding him solemnly with one gold-rimmed black eye.

“She’s taken him,” he said, softly.

summary: The Moon does not relinquish her hold on her old lover so easily, but the Imperial Household are up to the challenge.

title: On Borrowed Time
author: astrocryptographer
summary:
A choice of a different gateway in the jungle loops Fitzroy and Masseo back around to Zunidh. They arrive in the inauspicious span between the publication and the retraction of a certain newspaper edition about a landslide, and, oh, the world is not prepared for the grief of a great mage. Cliopher Mdang will not stay dead, even if the Lord of Zunidh needs to take a chainsaw to the very fabric of time to ensure it is so.

Kip will be fine, of course. Time, not so much.

title: The Bard and the Bureaucrat, and other poems
author: elīkabeha (Ollyver)
summary:
The Bard and the Bureaucrat went to sea
In a beautiful hand-hewn boat,
They took what he'd won, the fire of the Sun,
Wrapped up in Ani’s lost coat.

title: headhunting
author: iniquiticity
summary: His Radiancy was unsatisfied with his current head groomsman, the commander reported to Ser Rhodin, over breakfast. Another should be vetted and prepared for the inevitability he be dismissed. The next candidate was a minor Ystharian lord, called the Cavalier Conju enazo Argellevian an Vilius. Ser Rhodin put it on his to-do list to schedule an interview.

title: Cliopher Mdang does not think about ...
author: PotatoStaresBackATTACK
summary: It is important to note that, on the basis of what the Ourantha claims about time, Cliopher Mdang spent hundreds of years trying not to think about it. However, the fact that time was strange meant that he managed to write quite a lot of letters. And, even when he refused to think about something, that didn’t mean the truth wouldn’t fling itself through the space his words made. (Fact in point: though he did his best to not think about time, he did swim through oodles and oodles of it).

title: playing pretend
author: iniquiticity
summary:
“What are you thinking about?”

Kip laughed, “You,” he said, “Of course.” A long movement of his shoulder, and his sigh was long with pleasure.

“What am I doing?”

"You're washing the dishes."

title: Pins inside your fretted head

title: The Witness
author: SunInGlory
summary:
Emperor Eritanyr is dead. So is his heir Shallyr.

The Marwyn is brought to the Palace of Stars to become the hundredth Emperor of Astandalas.

One acolyte to the Ouranatha witnesses his arrival--his end and the emperor's beginning.

title: For Practice
author: Penguinity
summary:
What might have happened after Chapter 80 in Hands of the Emperor.

“You will be starting your quest here in Solaraa,” Cliopher said. “Perhaps the standard local greeting first?”

title: Sunbeams
author: alfgifu
summary:
So astrocryptographer had a dream that there was a fic where Kip and his Radiancy were having a romantic chat about adjusting health insurance when they got married. And elīkabeha pointed out that in Zunidh there is universal healthcare, so that wouldn't happen. But I thought Kip deserved a chance to be oblivious to flirting over government health insurance policy, dammit, because what could be more romantic than that?

Short, no plot, just fluff. :)

title: Both a plan and a schedule
author: alfgifu
summary:
Kip Mdang has qualified as an accountant, said his farewells to the firm that trained him, and is setting up for himself in a tiny office behind the Gorjo City waterfront.

He has the job he always wanted to support the life of the tanà he always intended to be. His family and friends are proud of him, his girlfriend Ghilly is just waiting for him to propose... everything is going according to plan, and everything is on schedule.

There is no reason for him to feel the slightest bit of reserve, of wistfulness about his situation.

Response to elīkabeha's fic prompt:

Kip is quietly getting on with being an accountant tanà in the mould of Uncle Lazo.
He's got his schedule. He's got his plan. Then crow crimes came out of nowhere...

NOTE: I have no plans at the moment to continue this story but would be delighted if anybody else wanted to do something with it. N+1 as the good folks say.

author: iniquiticity
summary: It would only be one game, after all. He had sent Cliopher to Littleridge for less. Cliopher had relentlessly uprooted corruption in the examinations without him even asking. It was not too bad - he was not abusing his power - to play one game of chess with him, was it?

author: astrocryptographer

title: To represent his will
author: mantrasong
summary:
The Last Emperor had removed a nasty curse that lingered there since the Fall in the course of a few hours.

That was not the work of a minor magical talent.

As he and the team returned to his apartments, Beren dared to allow himself to hope that perhaps - just perhaps - the Last Emperor would show a talent worthy of being the Lord Magus after all.

A mischievous god (or two) takes this visit as opportunity to drop them into Sky Ocean.

Chapter 3 takes place after the first scene of chapter 6 of dust and sand and is best read after that chapter
Chapter 4 takes place after the first scene of chapter 10 of dust and sand and is best read after all of dust and sand

author: SunInGlory
summary:
Cliopher gets distracted during a Council of Princes meeting--right when he's handing a new proclamation to his lord.

This causes...fewer problems than you would think. In fact, you could say it turns out to be quite fortuitous.

title: Showing them in words or deeds
author: alfgifu
summary:
Cliopher has been able to sense his Radiancy's emotions since his first year working as his secretary.

This changes less than you might think - until the day it changes everything.

author: electropeach

Cliopher had touched me and still lived; that was the good news.

A Touch AU from the maginificent scene at 27% for a flash prompt challenge

title: Beloved
author: atlantic_puffin
summary:
“Lord of Rising Stars, Lord Chancellor, is there any chance that you engaged in skin-on-skin contact? It is well documented that touch between the Lord Emperor and their consort causes a telepathic bond."

-

On the sky ship entering the Vangavaye-ve, Kip and HR touch. Kip only notices the empathetic bond two days later.

title: When the Emperor fell (and fell, and fell...)
author: seekeronthepath
summary:
The lights flickered. The Emperor fell.

Ludvic moved before he knew he was moving, rolling his lord onto his back, hands planted in the centre of his chest, silk robes slippery against his sweating palms as he forced His Radiancy's heart to beat. For once, he paid no mind to his surroundings, relying on Pikabe to care. All of him was bound up in the heart beneath his hands.

At last, the Emperor breathed.

His hands came up, ebony lacquered in gold, and they grasped Ludvic's arms, and there was the sound of something snapping.

Three days later, the lights flickered. The Emperor fell.

title: The Work of Rest
author: seekeronthepath
summary:
"Your experiences, whatever they were, seem to have restored you in a way I could not," Domina Audry said. "I think it very possible you will be as long-lived as your great-uncle."

 

It was Kip who pointed out what Domina Audry had left unspoken. As he had always made sure that the unspoken was known, and accounted for. "When I left, you didn't think so."

 

Fitzroy finds out that Kip was really, seriously working himself too hard.

(This fic is, possibly, a little bit Crimes. But also everyone is fine now.)

title: By All Accounts
author: astrocryptographer

author: alfgifu

It was the nature of the Great Game Aurieleteer to make extraordinary demands on its players. The rules were brutally simple, but the moves were breathtakingly intricate.

Circe of Aiaia had, at one time, prided herself on the efficient elegance of her stratagems.

title: Savelin

Under other circumstances that would undoubtedly please him greatly. Under the present circumstances, however –

HELP, the House sings, two minutes later. (The House has never sung before.) HELP. HELP. UPSTAIRS. HELP.

title: Hold on forever
author: SunInGlory
summary:
Kip hated the sense of desolation in the man's voice, the despair, the resignation at the foundering of the ship that was his ke'ea. No one should have to give up— “You could always stay here,” he offered. “No one would ever know.”

The man’s head popped up in astonishment—and, for the first time since coming in through Saya Dorn's pantry, he looked right at Kip, directly into Kip's eyes.

title: out of the sunrise

summary: The boy had discovered a previously unknown gift of wild magic- far too early for his age, and powerful enough to move them from their location altogether. It was a feat he had thought impossible within the bounds of the Schooled magic of the Empire.

title: I'm a stranger here myself
author: alfgifu
summary:
“Kip?”

Ah, he knew that voice. He turned his head, painfully slowly, and yes, improbable though it was - the other person - the man in bed with him - the blanket-thief - was -

Perhaps he was dreaming.

podfic of celebros' story

During their first month all together at the house, Ludvic, Rhodin, and Conju each took a turn at taking Kip aside and asking him about his feelings.

title: One Big Shadow and One Small
author: Marayanna
summary:
He went over the headline, the article, the headline again. He read the words over and over, but they refused to make any sense. A landslide, it said – but it couldn’t be right, surely? Someone like Cliopher Mdang, Lord Viceroy of Zunidh, couldn’t be felled by something so- so ordinary. Any storyteller with a bit of sense would know they had to come up with something absolutely spectacular if they wanted to make it a culmination of a life so astounding, so bright, so irreplaceable-

He snapped back to himself when he felt a crushing grip on his arm.

“Fitzroy!” Pali’s sharp voice pierced through the fog in his mind. Oh, it was raining? He suddenly noticed heavy droplets splashing on the pages. How peculiar. It was sunny just moments ago.

Fitzroy mourns.

title: A Multiple of Mages

title: Holding out for a hero
author: alfgifu
summary:
A scarlet mantle redder than the rose flares around tall shoulders; a sky blue tunic stands bold against the night sky; a wild thicket of hair, black and grey and gloriously free, streams out in all directions like a halo - this man has a harp in his hands, and a song on his lips - and a sword at his belt - and he strides over the threshold in a flurry of golden magic that ripples and flows like lava.

Cliopher does not know this person - he does not think he knows this person - he cannot see who this person is, and the pegs are screaming in his mind - he almost does not hear the words, but they resonate on every level so that even his pegboard sings them back to him: "WHERE IS HE?"

(In which the denizens of Sky Ocean should have known better than to kidnap Cliopher Mdang of Tahivoa, however clever and helpful he might be as an ornament to their demesnes.)

title: the heart of the world
author: crownedrooster
summary:
Inspired by Rhodin’s line in HOTE:
“(...) dear lord, Cliopher, I thought his Radiancy had spoken to you about making sure you take time for your health? No one wants you to have a heart attack!”

Alternate canon set during the events of The Hands of the Emperor: what if the heart attack happened to Kip instead?

title: The Elusive Cliopher inTahivoa
author: seekeronthepath
summary:
Sameon Metheris was, without overstating things, an expert on Cliopher Lord Mdang. Not the most expert, but his field of study was Lord Mdang’s philosophies of governance, and he was well-reputed in that field.

Cliopher inTahivoa was an extraordinary scholar of Vangavayen history, law, and political philosophy. Yet he never so much as alluded to the existence of Lord Mdang in his articles, and Sameon was not the only one to wonder whether there was some personal enmity at the root of it.

Sameon was determined to find out.

title: Caught Between a Spark and Lightning (Original)
author: mantrasong
summary:
Cliopher attempted many times to explain that his marriage had been one of convenience - she had needed a husband to avoid an awkward situation, and he had been available, unmarried, and willing to sign the paperwork. They both understood that they were free to seek other partners, and the marriage was dissolvable if either of them found someone that they truly wanted to marry.

It wasn’t as if he didn’t want to know if she was alive, particularly when she lived one town over from his cousin Basil, who he also hoped had survived. It was simply that, compared to the great work of rebuilding the world, the sacrifice of not knowing did not feel so great.

You had worked with Cliopher for two dozen years, or a thousand. You (I) had never been informed that he was married. Until the moment he decided to leave Zunidh (leave you, leave me) for her.

title: Swords and Sensibility
author: electropeach
summary:
Pali was not Fitzroy, who could spin a story from thin air at a moment’s notice, but Jullanar, blessedly, excelled at simply playing along, at taking an idea and running with it and making innocent comments that made the listener suspect there was much more going on. She stepped up, as she always did, with a secret smile just for Pali, and a flustered grin at the whole room, as if delighted and a little embarrassed by the attention.

 

Her hand was warm in Pali’s, her fingers trembling with hidden laughter, as she came to stand by Pali’s side and curtsied neatly to the Prince. Pali bowed again.

 

"My lord, may I present my wife?"

You blinked, forced yourself to focus on the print rather than the words. The hand of the writer, Kip Mdang of Tahivoa, according to the signature at the bottom of the page, was clear, pleasing—beautiful really, with simple flourishes that made the letter feel like a piece of art rather than an argument.

For all that the letter should never have made it to you, now that you had it in your hand, you could not imagine letting it go.

title: Hidden in plain sight
author: alfgifu
summary:
Then, with a flourishing bow, Ser Rhodin asked me to raise the Wall of Silence. You did so, intrigued. This was unusual, though not unheard of. He did, sometimes, have updates that could not be shared even with your inner guard.

His manner relaxed infinitesimally, once we had aural privacy. He withdrew a couple of somewhat crumpled sheets of paper from the pouch at his belt and placed them on my desk. “My lord, I regret to report that your Hands is engaged in a clandestine correspondence.”

title: All the things we could not say
author: mantrasong
summary:
“Are these the voices of the dead?” the Islander asked, his voice rich with concern.

“I don’t think so,” His Radancy said absently, his eyes unfocused and glowing. “There is something else going on here.” Once again he spoke in answer to the disembodied voice, and Cliopher blinked, expecting him to have been as surprised as he was. A suspicion began to bloom in the back of his mind, for twice now the second voice had mirrored his own thoughts.

He concentrated for a moment, focusing on a single clear thought, and a moment later, the second voice spoke out again. “Are these our thoughts?”

title: Disobedience
author: alfgifu
summary:
You glanced down at the new paper with mild concern and felt your emotions congeal into cold terror.

It was not a standard Council paper, though it came with the usual cover slip.

It was a warrant for Cliopher’s execution.

title: Synchronicity
author: seekeronthepath
summary:
The Emperor sits, nearly motionless, on a dais for the entire duration of the play, with his face in shadow. Restricted to the dais, The Emperor must nevertheless have a strong presence, and the full scope of the character must be communicated through posture, gesture, and voice. To do so while retaining an appropriately imperial demeanour requires great subtlety on the part of the actor.

 

The Secretary is more active, and seems at first the less challenging role. However, his ability to shift subtly between personal speech and speech on behalf of The Emperor is essential to the impact of the play. The Secretary must be aware of and attuned to the Emperor at all times, without ever looking at him until the final scene. 

 

In among all the thinly-veiled plays about His Radiancy and Kip, this one is about the simultaneous separation and synchronicity between the Emperor and his Secretary.

~*~

After several months—maybe longer—he brings me gifts. “We do not have crows where I am from, but I am told you lot like pretty things.” And he proceeds to give me shiny baubles. I have already learned that I can handle things as a crow that my taboos would object to as a human. title: The Truth That Binds
author: rattyjol
summary:
The settee she indicated was uncomfortably low, and as her chair opposite was of a more ordinary height, there was something looming about the way she looked down upon me once we had both seated ourselves. I held my spine very straight. “I’m afraid there may be some misunderstanding, Saya Etaris,” I said, keeping my voice pleasant and polite only through the mustering of every scrap of comportment that Madame Clancette had been able to drill into me. “I have yet to give Sergeant Etaris my answer.” What had Ben been thinking, to tell his mother? I had told him I needed time to consider his proposal, and he had promised me that time.

“Of course,” Saya Etaris said, in a condescending tone of voice which very neatly conveyed the unsaid portion of her sentence: Of course, that answer will be yes.

title: Security in this Age
author: mantrasong
summary:
“Lady Liminal Hours,” said the man, apparently unconcerned by the threat of her magic.

She considered him. He was too fit to be a decorative noble or an ambitious wizard, too striking to be a common spy, too wealthy to be employed in service to any but the highest nobility, and it was unlikely he was here representing himself. She took a shot in the dark. “Ser Guard,” she responded.

The slightest widening of the eyes, and his slow appreciative smile told her that she had hit close to the mark.

“I thought it was time that you and I had a conversation”

title: The Fourth Game

Your eyes remain locked on mine yet that serene mask is impervious.

Rhodin was aware that his job required a certain ambiguity; a certain emptiness; the lack of his heart did not, generally, trouble him. One would have to have a heart to miss a heart. He had his safeguards. And yet, the thought that he might be learning to be as wise as his dear imposter was a consolation for the lack he did not feel. The ambiguity might yet resolve into seeing the world as she saw it: fractured, and glorious, and mirrored, and whole; an iridescent vision from a dragonfly’s multifaceted eye.

title: The King Who Wanted To Touch The Moon
author: alfgifu
summary:
The king was so anxious that he could not sleep. In the middle of the night he looked out of the window and saw the silvery moon riding high in the sky and, there and then, he wanted to reach out and touch her. The moon was beautiful, and she did not have to do what the emperor wanted.

But even a king couldn’t reach the moon. So he thought about it, and he thought about it. Night and day he thought about it. And at last he worked out a way of touching the moon. He would have a tall, tall tower built that reached to the sky, and then, when he had climbed to the top, he would be able to touch the moon.

I woke up. I knew I was awake, as the lights were still on softly as Cliopher had promised they always would be.

I could feel the tears gather in my eyes, and as much as I tried to hold them back this time I failed and they escaped, trailing down my cheeks and falling. I curled onto my side, away from Kip, and cried as silently as I was able. I had a lot of experience crying silently; I had gotten good at it. Unfortunately, none of that experience involved hiding it from someone who was in the bed with me.

---

Artorin Damara isn't emperor anymore, but he isn't free of it, either. At least now he has someone to comfort him from his nightmares. This is not necessarily an improvement.

title: Tomorrow changes
author: alfgifu
summary:
Conju finished his steady pacing along the final side of the great Bath. He emptied his basket, slung it comfortably over his arm, and strolled back to where his closest confidante and dearest friend was standing just inside the door, looking mesmerised.

“Your first sight of the bath, eh?”

Cliopher Sayo Mdang visibly collected himself. Conju noted his distraction, noted the wideness of his eyes and the tension in his stance, and felt the first tiny intimation of worry.

Was.

He took a sip first, his eyes on mine yet again, then he offered it to me.

title: Falling
author: alfgifu
summary:
Kip curled at the edge of the great bed of the Emperor of Astandalas and wondered why his stomach still lurched as though he were falling.

It was nothing physical. The surface of the bed was secure beneath him, the coverlet warm, the pillows astonishingly comfortable.

He had not known what to expect when he asked the Emperor to continue this pretence of taking him as a concubine. All he knew was that there was a danger to himself, his home, and his family if the nobility of the Empire saw him rejected by the Sun-on-Earth. And so Kip had asked, and the Emperor had agreed.

title: On Display
author: tales_of_rhys
summary:
In front of him, His Radiancy lounged on a chaise, occasionally selecting some canapé from the table at his side, but his eyes remained fixed on Kip. HR had promised that he would watch Kip the entire time he was up here, in this- picture frame, actually. It was a picture frame cut into the wall, with enough space for Kip to be displayed for HR's pleasure. The builders had framed the opening in an ornate (gaudy) gold trim, but the inset Kip was in was entirely white.

Three times the Evil!Household puts someone on display.

title: Here comes the sun
author: alfgifu
summary: He had not realised, when he asked his Radiancy to pretend to take him as a concubine, how much effort that would require of the Lord of Rising Stars. He had not known how presumptuous he was being. His Radiancy had been kind enough to agree, but perhaps – perhaps he was regretting it now.

title: Caught Between a Spark and Lightning
author: mantrasong
summary:
Cliopher attempted many times to explain that his marriage had been one of convenience - she had needed a husband to avoid an awkward situation, and he had been available, unmarried, and willing to sign the paperwork. They both understood that they were free to seek other partners, and the marriage was dissolvable if either of them found someone that they truly wanted to marry.

It wasn’t as if he didn’t want to know if she was alive, particularly when she lived one town over from his cousin Basil, who he also hoped had survived. It was simply that, compared to the great work of rebuilding the world, the sacrifice of not knowing did not feel so great.
——
Revisiting a flash fiction story, now in extended form

title: Ain't no sunshine (when he's gone)
author: alfgifu, iniquiticity
summary:
The Emperor of five worlds lay spread across his bed, above it, his hands gripping the ropes that supported his wrists, trying to keep his weight up – trying not to make a noise.

---

One night and one day, he reminded himself. That was all the time he needed to buy them. A night and a day needed to prepare Damara, and another night uninterrupted together to transfer the anchor of Schooled Magic, and then - the restoration of Astandalas. Glory. Triumph. Absolute power.

But to get there, he would have to imitate this man's perversions for a full twenty four hours.

title: Rough handling
author: alfgifu
summary:
Handling would certainly be needed this evening. I could feel the slight tug on the rope at my wrist as I pulled Kip along. His easy ability to keep pace with me made this less than satisfying as an outlet for my – frustration, call it frustration. (Better not to invoke fear, or fury, or any of the wilder emotions that shook and swirled beneath the parts of myself I deemed appropriate for you to acknowledge.) He had endangered himself. Deliberately. (I had no words to express my outraged panic on his behalf.)

Kip knew he was in trouble, of course.

title: The Virtue of Being True

summary:
"You're under an enchantment, Cliopher. The good news is that the protections his Radiancy has placed on you have shielded you; the bad news is that the protections that block the spell are also reflecting it, meaning that instead of you it affects everyone who comes near you. You may have noticed an unusual propensity for candor in your vicinity today?"

 

A reverse truth serum plot leads to Cliopher having a very strange day.

A traitor, somewhere in the Imperial Guard. An assignment – oh, those fools had taken it as a demotion, as an insult to his noble blood, but he knew what du Nuale had been hinting at – an assignment to investigate the Emperor’s own. To become (he was fairly certain) the closest placed agent to the person of the Sun-on-Earth.

It was a shame, really, that he knew so little about dragons.

So he makes him coffee.

Rhodin sipped his coffee. “Are us roommates cramping your style?”

“No,” Conju demurred, in a way which clearly meant yes. “I value you all deeply and am satisfied with a . . . laissez-faire . . . living situation in our retirement.”

Ludvic stirred his coffee. Rhodin peeled a banana in a desultory way. They waited.

Conju sighed. “It’s just–“ Ludvic and Rhodin leaned forward as Conju continued, “– why does he have to be underfoot all the time? Overnight?! I came down for a drink last week and nearly broke my neck tripping over a middle-aged aristocrat. It’s undignified.”

“What?” Cliopher asked, hope sparking like a fire in his chest. “Save you? How?”

His Radiancy shook his head ever so slightly. “Not save, but let me—”

As of December 2022, 38 out of 57 goats have been destroyed or damaged in some way." ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G%C3%A4vle_goat

"On Thursday, the city's goat committee held an emergency meeting and decided to let the goat stand, despite the attacking birds and the risk that it will look increasingly threadbare as Christmas approaches.

"It's about that Christmas spirit, and the goat will continue to spead that Christmas spirit," Niemann told SvD. "It doesn't feel right to frighten away birds who are only following their natural instincts and want to have food." ~ https://www.thelocal.se/20231214/swedens-gavle-goat-is-christmas-dinner-for-peckish-birds

title: He May
author: novaauster
summary:
It is my bones that hurt this time. I prefer it to the just-under-skin pain, the pain that itched and squirmed like a living thing, separating my skin from me like a child tearing the fine layered top off of a baklava. That magic moved up, and down, and up, and down, ever-changing, never-ending. This magic simply sits, heavy as an atmosphere. This magic is the weather like the weather is a god.

You are that god.

title: somewhere up the road
author: rattyjol
summary:

Even when that personal business was retirement.

title: Until Love Stops Screaming
author: alfgifu, mantrasong
summary:
Kip had never been this reserved for me. Nervous and uncertain, yes, but not reserved. He was still mine, and I needed him to remember that. “What have you to say for yourself?”

He hesitated, and I gave him the time. If he was going to resist the pull of the leash, then I was willing to draw this out as long as necessary to understand why.

“Your Radiancy,” he said, “I have come to beg a boon of you.” He stopped there, waiting. I was frozen, trapped behind you, who held yourself in perfect stillness. The creeping uncertainty was coiling in the pit of my stomach, and I needed you to contain it. When I didn’t answer, he continued. “Your Radiancy, I have come to ask you to remove my collar, and release me from your service.”
---
The long journey home after the Fall gave Kip time to think about the nature of his relationship with his Radiancy, but when he returned to Solaara to ask for his freedom, his Radiancy was not enthusiastic about letting him go. With Kip only partially released from his Radiancy’s service, both he and the Emperor must come to grips with what has happened, and find a way to live with it.

title: How do I leave the worst job ever?
author: banana_scale
summary:
Dear Alison,
To put it succinctly: I have the worst job ever that one can have in modern society, in a day and age where there is no slavery. I have been in my job for 30 or 1000 years depending on how you look at it. From the outside it probably looks like I have an excellent job. I am famous, if I told you my name you would know who I am and what I look like. I am given the best of everything, from food, to clothing, to artwork and healthcare. Everyone is very respectful of me, at least to my face, and it is not an exaggeration that saying anything bad about me would be considered treason. In theory, I am the most powerful man in the world.

“What,” the creature crooned, its talons digging into the tree stump it was seated on, “is it that you want?”
A shiver went down my spine as the words resonated through me in a familiar way I could not quite place. I felt something lurking right at the edge of my memory, but I knew that it would only elude me if I tried to grasp it, so I shook my head and focused on the creature again.
(It is of the Ones born of the Fall, the Vangavayen god had said. A trickster, both like and unlike me. Be very careful with your words, little bard.)
“I want you to give me back what you took from me last time.”

Jemis comes home stressed from a long day, and Mr. Dart wants to help.

title: Years Away
author: tales_of_rhys
summary:
Kip started to do the math in his head and soon was gaping at his sister.

“How- how is a number like that possible?” He asked her.

---

Artorin and Cliopher wait for their soulmate timers to count down.

summary:
It was, I think, in the way he said it that morning.
“Shall we go home?”
So casually, so carelessly, like he had not given the words any thought at all – like it was something simple and natural and common.

Fitzroy navigates retired life in Gorjo City and his feelings about home.

(Does not require reading earlier parts of the series.)

author: breadandroses
summary:
Devotion, by Robert Frost

The heart can think of no devotion
Greater than being shore to ocean -
Holding the curve of one position,
Counting an endless repetition.

Fitzroy and Cliopher, in retirement, explore their new relationship using elements of their old one.

OR:
“It appears getting fake married is a lot more like getting real married when one’s plans involve an actual magistrate.” Mr. Dart said distantly as he read through the papers.

title: In every heart there is a room
author: alfgifu
summary:
Fitzroy is delighted when he catches Kip confusing an ordinary crow for his corvid form - until, that is, he hears the confession that Kip feels safer sharing with his beloved wearing feathers.

How did they misunderstand one another so completely, in that conversation on the vaha?

And where will opening their hearts take them together?

(Title, of course, from "And so it goes" by Billy Joel.)

title: Two Gentlemen go a-walkin’
author: PotatoStaresBackATTACK
summary: The young men are where they’ve been before—a moment of high emotions, drama, a stage of a plot that tends to happen around and to them—but this day is unequivocally Different.

title: the fences in your way

summary: Kip invites his Radiancy for a visit.

author: banana_scale, rattyjol

title: Navanoa’s God
author: MerlinKing
summary:
A century after the creation of Navanoa, Fitzroy still lived, bound and banished from death where he acted as the deity of the island.

Kip was dead, presumably sailing with the ancestors. Fitzroy seeks nothing more than to join him, but his curse is strong.

Perhaps one day, somehow, he’ll be able to die and sail with him

title: You're the only one who knows
author: SunInGlory
summary:
A declaration of love from Fitzroy to Kip - written after the events of alfgifu's In every heart there is a room.

This can be read as a standalone, but the original fic is absolutely wonderful so I recommend reading it first.

title: Lord Meriloe's retreat.
author: Kezia_SherlockJohn_HofTE
summary: The Master of Offices, Lord Meriloe, needs to go away for a while, but his destination might not be quite what he had in mind.

title: A Study on the Common and Uncommon Varieties of Woodbine (Lonicera periclymenum) in Northwest Oriole
author: library_lion
summary:
"I turned around for not even a moment to look at a honeysuckle," Hal said to Mr. Dart, and then gave me a fondly exasperated look as I joined them by the stove. "Jemis, you really need to start thinking things through before you jump into action.”

After narrowly escaping more trouble with the local highwaymen, Jemis instead finds himself in some trouble with his friends.

title: Five Ways Cliopher Mdang Didn't Introduce Himself
author: vass
summary: Anyone reading this presumably already knows the one way he did.

title: You can't tell me that you're fine
author: SunInGlory
summary:
Cliopher had written me—the Sun-on-Earth, the Lord of Rising Stars, the Last Emperor of Astandalas and Lord of Zunidh—a personal letter. I blinked at the ridiculousness of it. But then, Cliopher had never been one to truckle to authority. I glanced up at Conju, who was holding something in his hands—a single, small envelope.

At my curiosity, he tilted the letter so I could see it better. Even from a distance, I could recognize the beautiful hand of my sec—former secretary. “Cliopher wrote a personal letter—” I whispered, slightly dumbstruck. “—to me.”

Also known as the Retirement Fic (aka: His Radiancy forces Cliopher to retire).

title: The Emperor and his Viceroy
author: rattyjol
summary: A folk song which arose in Old Damara near the end of Lord Emperor Artorin's reign, and which remained popular well into the reign of Lady Aurelia.

title: a deeper dive
author: crownedrooster
summary:
“He floated and sank, again and again, for a long time, before voices started to reach him. They were not the right kind of voices. There should have been singing, his dazed mind noted. There had been singing, he distantly remembered, but his Ancestors were gone, and he had ended up in this other place, where these other voices were whispering around him in urgent and serious tones.”

Written for fey's prompt: HR at Kip's bedside after a barely prevented assassination attempt

title: our hands, out of control
author: WhenasInSilks
summary:
Cliopher had always been observant—always had a good memory, even when that memory was not further sharpened by envy (and how envious he had been! how burningly, foolishly jealous of those blazons of his Radiancy’s trust—the marks of his Radiancy’s own hands, the hands which gave Cliopher his title, his chiefest authority and his place in the world, and yet, when the moment came it had not been him but Ludvic—)

He grasped the hem of his overcoat, the sheer silk a whispering ghost of a barrier between his fingertips.

“The marks,” he said. “How long have they been growing?”

aka the Midas Touch AU

title: The One Less Traveled By
author: Slecnaztemnot
summary: After the Fall but before he gains his position as an Imperial Secretary, Cliopher Mdang comes across a secret passage in the Palace. There, he meets a mysterious dark-skinned man with a guard. He makes the only reasonable conclusion - the man he met must be none other than the famous poet Fitzroy Angursell, kept there as a prisoner! Or is he?

title: Backslide
author: Owlwinter
summary:
After eight hundred glorious years of working together, his Radiancy is rather distressed at the news of his secretary’s probable death.

Or: in which a certain landslide happens far earlier than in canon.

title: but not today
author: kerithwyn
summary: Rhodin had a cunning plan.

title: East First
author: fire_eyes_chica
summary:
"East first, then west and home"

Before they can settle into their well-deserved retirement, first Kip and Fitzroy need to return to the Palace of Stars for the Jubilee celebrations. It's harder than it seems.

title: The Cock with the Comb in the Bee at the Border
author: Quasar
summary: Fitzroy considers availing himself of an open fanoaship. Jullanar corrects him.

title: Little darling
author: alfgifu
summary:
I had to stand and swallow the lump in my throat, and reassert my control over my features, as it struck me for the first time that I was planning for our future. We had a future together, and for Kip I could make it spectacular.

In which his Radiancy establishes a household for his concubine.

This is an evil!household story, with all that that implies for terrible choices and tragic outcomes. It follows immediately from the events of Here comes the sun.

title: these unfaithful hands
author: rattyjol
summary:
His feet were moving again, though he did not recall deciding to go anywhere. He crossed the room, past his desk, past the plinth with the asymmetrical vase, past the tapestry map and the golden nightingale in its cage. Past the terrace, where he had been pleased to break his fast with his Radiancy—only this morning? It felt a thousand years away.

He was standing before the ivory door to the inner apartments, which he had passed through only a handful of times before. His hand raised of its own accord, and the door fell open beneath it.

He became aware, with a creeping dread like tendrils up his throat, that something was terribly wrong.

title: Rufus Of Amboloyo's Unparalleled Froyo
author: resplendeo
summary:
A fan-game hack of the wonderful one-page game Jason Statham's Big Vacation by Grant Howitt and Chris Taylor. If you're not familiar with that game, please do go check it out! Additionally, a lot of different actual-play type podcasts have played through it.

In the spirit of one-page games, I've typeset it to fit on one (letter-sized) page. I have ... less than zero idea of what ao3 will make of it, honestly; it might be made to stretch to multiple pages. Can you imagine? The gall.

title: minor benedictions
author: acrobats
summary:
He’s nothing like Kip thought.

The first glimpse Cliopher gets of His Radiancy, the occasion of him swearing his fealty notwithstanding, consists of the Sun-on-Earth’s turned back as he paces up and down his office.

(Or: Kip's perspective on his first day as His Radiancy's secretary.)

title: Cinders
author: electropeach
summary:
Kip Mdang had just made it to Ysthar when the news came: the Emperor was dead.

 

A pre-HotE AU in which Cliopher decides to go to Astandalas a few years earlier and happens on the ship ferrying Fitzroy from the Tower to the Palace.

title: Re: the iguana
author: vass
summary: What we do not talk about when we talk about iguanas: a memorandum.

author: crownedrooster

“Rise and take your seat,” the Voice said.

A Petty Treasons AU about Cliopher's first day as the Emperor's secretary.

title: Just the two of us
author: rattyjol
summary:
“Jullanar, look! Our very own wanted posters!”

Or: Jullanar and Fitzroy on the run.

title: Much Ado About A Bed
author: fire_eyes_chica
summary:
Adventuring is varied. Sometimes you are the guest of a great lord, and sometimes you are staying at the worst inn in nine worlds during a rainstorm.

Fortunately, there is a cozy bed for Kip and Fitzroy to share. The others are not so lucky.

author: mantrasong
summary:
A direct sequel to Until Love Stops Screaming
Kip and His Radiancy have a conversation as equals. It goes about as well as you'd expect.

"And so it was that they had ended up in a conundrum: with the Mdang house bursting at the seams with sundry relatives, there was only one bed left, which Cliopher and Conju would have to share."

Written for the Only one bed Flash Fic Challenge

title: The Imperial Bed
author: atlantic_puffin
summary:
Outside that door were layers upon layers of Imperial Guards, protecting the life of the Last Emperor of Astandalas, the Lord Magus of Zunidh, and for some reason, his secretary.

Inside that door were two guards, and inside the sheer privacy of the foamwork curtains, there was only his Radiancy and Cliopher.

title: Sardines
author: Quasar
summary: Kip acquires a pair of new cousins.

title: Nox wants to eat
author: alfgifu
summary:
Nox is primal hunger and endless want, but it has gone to a great deal of effort to make an appropriate fleshthing to wear to the Palace of Stars.

A shame, really, that all the beds are taken.

title: Worship and Devotion
author: tales_of_rhys
summary:
"All mine, aren't you? Mine to fuck, mine to share, mine to own and hurt and pleasure," Conju said.

The morale of the people of Zunidh requires a focus, and Artorin is the figurehead of that focus. One specific worshipper makes acting as the figurehead worthwhile.

Once is a luck, twice is a coincidence, and the third time...

Roald and Perry find themselves together at the river again. Some things are the same, some things are different, and some things they still won't talk about.

title: Into the dark
author: alfgifu
summary:
The Last Emperor of Astandalas and Lord of Zunidh wrought a great work of magic to bring his Lord Chancellor back from the dead.

That might have been an error.

title: Fireheart
author: PotatoStaresBackATTACK
summary:
The Ouranatha have worked hard to make the sleeping Emperor into a god, but when he starts to stir—and thus threatening their power—they bind another into the taboos and put the Emperor back to sleep! All the sleeping Emperor knows is that as he runs through nightmares of darkness, a light appears to guide him to a roaring campfire. There he meets a man who calls himself Fireheart.
This changes Everything.

title: Angursell: An Anonymous Folk Poem. Commentary and Annotation by Fitzroy Angursell and Jullanar of the Sea
author: acrobats
summary: When you're an infamous poet, it's inevitable that poems will also be written about you.

there is something I can’t find."

A pair of poems (each the reverse of the other) exploring Fitzroy's state of mind during The Return of Fitzroy Angursell!

title: common and ordinary goods
author: ariex09
summary:
It’s possible Cliopher was still a little drunk, either from the magic, the giddy relief of feeling finally at ease with his family, or the more mundane cause of the alcohol that he’d drunk that night. Regardless of the reason, when the idea came, it came at a delay, after the door was already swinging shut behind his Radiancy, and he didn’t hesitate the way he ordinarily might have, wondering if it was crossing a line; he just got up.

-

After the Viceroy ceremony, Cliopher takes advantage of a new opportunity.

title: Non-Euclidean Geography
author: rattyjol
summary: There is always a moment, when someone encounters us unexpectedly for the first time, when recognition strikes and their face changes entirely, with a truly extraordinary range of possible expressions. This young man, it seemed, was going for pinch me I must be dreaming.

title: one for a token, two for a promise
author: acrobats
summary:
“Well,” he said, pure delight in his voice, “if you insist on asking me, I think that the infamous rebel Fitzroy Angursell abducting the Viceroy of Zunidh would make for a shocking tale for the good citizens of Solaara.”

“You’re pardoned,” Kip pointed out flatly. “And I’m retired.”

author: Quasar
summary: His Radiancy is alarmed to hear of an attempt to abduct his Lord Chancellor.

Jemis encounters Roald Ragnor while out on his morning run around Ragnor Bella. The Honorable Rag could use his assistance.

Someone tied Roald to a tree and Jemis happens to stumble across him.

title: How Our Love Employs (H.O.L.E.)
author: toffeecape
summary: From the 9worldskinkmeme prompt: *waking up mad for no reason and immediately coming to kinkmeme* why as a fandom have we all collectively (and correctly) decided Cliopher is a champion muffdiver and yet there is hardly any fic out there of him rimming Fitzroy. what brave hero will rectify this travesty.

title: Going out with a bang
author: alfgifu
summary:
Fitzroy has been growing increasingly jittery as the Red Company approaches Solaara for the Jubilee. It's not a surprise when he asks Cliopher to run away with him for one last night of freedom.

Almost everything that follows is.

(All fics in this series build out from events in Embers - and therefore spoil it - but I've tried to keep them viable as stand-alones too.)

title: unscheduled
author: iniquiticity
summary: Kip only meant to spend a little time with Conju to let him know about some taxes changes that he might like. Sometimes, however, you end up taking more time than you originally scheduled. It's worth if you learn something or get a new experience, though. (He does.)

title: The Purple Wizard in the Tower of Halibut Salad
author: toffeecape
summary: In a lonely tower at the edge of the world, a young man has found a golden key, an aphorism, and a spell, but not yet a name nor the trick to enchanting a bag to hold all his supplies. One day he looks out his window and sees something odd on the beach.

title: feeling is first
author: WhenasInSilks
summary:
The night before I left for my quest I could not sleep.

response to a kinkmeme prompt: Kip walks into the imperial bedchamber in the middle of the night before His Radiancy is set to leave for his quest, and rides him hard on the imperial bed. Bonus points if it's from HR's pov.

title: We’ll Make It Right For You
author: Owlwinter
summary:
You turn to look at Cliopher in absolute, utter betrayal. Cliopher discovered that you have daughters - daughters! – and brought them to the Palace!? Here, the name Damara would smother any child of yours with taboo and tradition, any ounce of freedom stripped painfully away-

“While away, I encountered these two girls, named Circe and Aurelia,” Cliopher tells you, steady as the rock on which the world has always turned. “With your permission, my lord, I will adopt them myself, and raise them as my daughters here in the Palace of Stars.”
--
Or: in which rumors reach the Lord Chancellor of two teenage girls with golden lion eyes.

title: A Place Designed to Kill/Save
author: Zaftikat
summary:
Roald Ragnor was a seventeen-year-old libertine when his best friend, Jemis Greenwing, disappeared. After four years in a spiral, he wakes up in an unfamiliar place: the basement of Dorley Hall. His survival depends on his ability to adapt to the changes that the Hall enforces on Inductees, and his ability to mollify the other boys taken in to the Programme.

Meanwhile, Primrose Harper, a Dorley Graduate, lives a quiet, happy life as a law student until a set of surprises upend her life. First, she learns that her childhood friend, Roald Ragnor, has been taken by the same Programme that saved her. Then she finds out that her father—long presumed dead—is still alive. How will her quiet life change now that two important parts of her past are part of her present?

(Modern AU G&D that asks: What if our beloved characters' lives were upended by Dorley Hall?)

title: “Behold, your new Lady Empress ... Shield of the - gurk!”
author: kerithwyn
summary: Images inspired by toffeecape's fic "Bring the Lion Out," made with Hero Forge.

title: Homecoming
author: rattyjol
summary: The narrowness of the staircase up to the solarium obliged me to remove my arm from Kip’s shoulders, with reluctance, but our fingers tangled together at the small of my back, our steps slow and heavy up the creaky old stairs. I had dozed earlier in the evening, but that energy had long since worn off, after two sleepless nights and a whirlwind week before it. And Kip had heroically saved himself and half a dozen others from the heyday of Astandalas, and then entertained much of the Red Company and a rota of Mdangs besides. He had earned a little exhaustion.

title: Chantling (All fear gives way)
author: thehollowoak
summary: Fanart of the fic "All fear gives way"

author: toopunkrockforshul
summary: A tribute to the Lady in Her green aspect.

”I love you. I want you to love me. I want to be someone who can be loved. I want to have my love known”.

Kip and Fitzroy go sailing.

title: My Lord (Please Don't Take My Bath)
author: acrobats
summary:
My Lord, My Lord, My Lord, My Lord
I′m begging of you, please, don't take my bath
My Lord, My Lord, My Lord, My Lord
“There’s room for two,” sounds quite a bit like math

title: a gift beyond measure
author: crownedrooster
summary:
I watch, entranced, as Conju proceeds to prepare the head of my government, my Lord Chancellor, my Hands, to take his cock.

Written for the kinkmeme prompt: putting on a show for HR

title: Fly me to the moon
author: breadandroses
summary:
Kinkmeme prompt: Kip walks into the imperial bedchamber in the middle of the night before His Radiancy is set to leave for his quest, and rides him hard on the imperial bed. Bonus points if it's from HR's pov.

PWP more than welcome, no context or explanation needed (unless you really want to come up with some of course!)

 

As you might expect, the last line of the prompt was a challenge song for me.

title: Seeded full with light
author: alfgifu
summary:
Kinkmeme prompt: His Radiancy can't touch, but he can still look! Someone gets Kip off in front of HR. Maybe it's Kip getting himself off, maybe it's the whole household putting on a show, maybe it's Maybelline!

Cliopher Mdang has survived three whole days as personal secretary to the Sun-on-Earth - but that might be about to change. In the face of a magical emergency he can only offer to help out, whatever it takes - despite his new lord's evident discomfort. That's got to be some kind of treason, right?

title: Mixed Greens
author: rattyjol
summary:
It was Jullanar, looking sheepish and a little flustered in her nightclothes and dressing gown. Her usual coronet had been taken down into one thick braid, with the low magelight from the inn’s hallway picking out the many different colors of her hair.

"I'm sorry to bother you," she said, her smile a touch rueful. "It's only, well, there's a goose in my bed."

title: of the sea
author: ariex09
summary:
Truthfully I was at least as preoccupied with looking for a post office as I was with looking for the continuation of our adventure. Kip’s favorite cousin, alive! I needed to send a letter at the earliest available opportunity. A pity we were in Voonra; I had no idea what situation the post offices here were in, since even Kip’s domain over the post didn’t extend past the borders of Zunidh. Possibly teleportation through portals created by magical maybe-tigers was more effective than the actual postal system and I would have to wait a full fortnight until Sardeet could send my next letter, who knew.

-

In which Fitzroy receives more omens than he knows what to do with, writes a letter, and discusses various Mdangs.

title: Fate and Feathers
author: Leah_The_Laudable
summary:
His Radiancy and Cliopher are supposed to be soulmates, but they refuse to acknowledge it! Don’t worry, some very helpful (chaotic) geese show up to help.

Or: The geese took over the plot. Oops.

title: The Kindred Constrait
author: PotatoStaresBackATTACK
summary: Jemis smiles at the Hunter’s green mask and cannot stop himself from bursting out into giggles. The Hunter’s hands gripped his arms a little tighter. “Sorry, sorry, sorry.” He mutters when he gets hold of himself. “But why do I need a goose to show me the way to a soulmate?”

title: "He was leaning back against Fitzroy’s chest..."
author: kerithwyn
summary: Images inspired by tales_of_rhys's fic "Quiet," made with Hero Forge.

title: Should I tell you what I want?
author: SunInGlory
summary: On the sky ship back to Solaara after the Viceroyship ceremony, Cliopher and his Radiancy....talk. Shocking, I know.

title: Have this heart to break
author: SunInGlory
summary:
In the aftermath of a Woodlark-like incident in the Vangavaye-ve after the fateful vacation, his Radiancy struggles with his own sense of guilt and a heartbroken Kip.

A surprise arrival offers hope.

title: yeah, with a viceroy like that it's serious
author: WhenasInSilks
summary:
Five (and a half) times Cliopher doesn't notice getting propositioned at the Jubilee, plus one time he does (and one time he does the propositioning).

response to a kinkmeme prompt: If Fitzroy decides to keep his name and fanoaship quiet during the Jubilee, he runs the risk of people finding out he and Kip aren't married yet and taking what they think is their last chance to shoot their shot with Kip. Bonus points if all the courtly euphemistic proposals continue to fly right over Kip's head but Fitzroy perceives every one and is Not Pleased.

title: Saving Fitzroy: Jullanar of the Sea
author: kerithwyn
summary: Jullanar, a road not taken.

title: nothing less than the world
author: ariex09
summary:
At least there wasn’t an audience for the look Ludvic turned on Kip and the too neutral way he said, “Tor?”

Kip could feel himself flushing - in Astandalas this was the kind of thing that had lost him jobs before - but he had the excuse of, first of all, amnesia, and second of all, “He didn’t give me any other name!” Kip hissed. “He deflected me off the topic twice!”

-

AU where the landslide at the Liauu happens several years earlier, and the younger Kip has a rather different experience of the future.

title: Swing and a Miss
author: Owlwinter
summary:
Cliopher goes to the Palace of Stars with a singular goal: to assassinate the 100th Emperor of Astandalas.

The plan goes rather sideways.

title: Supporting Evidence
author: rattyjol
summary: Domina Ivy Black, tenured Professor of Late Astandalan History at the University of Stoneybridge, had very little on her conscience worth being accused of. Pali Avramapul of the Red Company… was another matter.

title: The Riddles This World Made for Me
author: electropeach
summary: A day in the life of the very young Red Company: Fitzroy encounters new Midsummer traditions and engages in experimental magic, unplanned intermundial adventuring, and accidental time travel.

title: Faces of the Nine Worlds: Greenwing and Dart

There were consequences and horrors, yes, but it mattered, that he rose to the occasion. After all, hadn’t he always wanted his Radiancy to want for only him, for as long as there had been a Radiancy that was his?

author: SunInGlory
summary:
Prompt: Cliopher somehow falls asleep on HR’s robe, and rather than wake him, HR has one of the guards cut that part of the robe off of him. Just looking for something soft and sweet here, but of course go in whichever direction you’d like. Bonus points if Petty Treasons era.

---

title: axis
author: merrivale
summary:
It is a defense of Fitzoy Angursell’s poetry. Of the importance of criticism, and free speech, and giving hope and beauty to the people. Of free and open debate, and new ideas, and a world that provides for everyone. It is a defense of the man who–

You almost cannot bear to read it. You cannot stop.

Inspired by SunInGlory's lovely A Treasonous Request.

title: Ginger Tea
author: rattyjol
summary: Conju is feeling under the weather; Fitzroy steps in.

title: Daisies, Pushed
author: rattyjol
summary: Cliopher Mdang lay before you. You thought about what it would be like to touch him.

title: Hold on to the Promise
author: fire_eyes_chica
summary:
He was dressed, once more, at the very edge of fashion, and he looked fabulous. He wasn’t wearing full-court or even half-court costume this evening. He was dressed to go out and be seen. He had had reservations at one of the most popular up-and-coming restaurants, the kind with a tall outdoor patio where people could admire the esteemed patrons at their exclusive tables. He had additional, quieter reservations for after dinner at a very particular club, where those in attendance wore a cloth mask and the guise of anonymity, even if the goal was to be just as seen and watched.

All those delightful plans now lay in ashes at the feet of the Imperial Spymaster.

 

Conju and Rhodin renegotiate their relationship to each other.

title: two days five hours
author: ariex09
summary:
Jullanar didn’t realize anything was wrong until the newspaper boy yelped in panic, until she was turning back to see the paper Fitzroy was holding on fire, a conflagration held in one hand, his eyes liquid gold with magic and his voice perfectly empty when he said, “No. That can’t be right. There’s been a mistake.”

-

In which an adventure in progress is thoroughly derailed by news of the presumed death of the Viceroy of Zunidh.

title: Plausible Deniability and Pineapple
author: toffeecape
summary: In which the Last Emperor of Astandalas and Lord of Zunidh is an unbonded sentinel (as if he didn't have enough problems) and Cliopher sayo Mdang rejects the entire classist and culturally imperialistic sentinel/guide paradigm out of hand and offers his Radiancy... almost the exact same thing, honestly, but done their way.

title: Duty and Penance
author: LiveDoveDoNotPerceive
summary:
The empire has fallen, and the Ouranatha will take what they need from the useless emperor who allowed it to happen.

A kinkmeme fill.

title: how it tastes to be alive
author: WhenasInSilks
summary:
The roses had withered long since.

Two lonely men, adrift at the end of the world.

--

written for the kink meme prompt: Ludvic has been out in the world for quite a while now. He’s gotten used to the idea of men having sex with each other (he thinks). Doing that himself, though, has always been a step too far. (Probably.)

But it’s the end of the world, and if he’s going to break his own rules, he may as well break them with the one aristocrat in this entire palace who is capable of propositioning him without making him feel like some kind of museum exhibit.

title: The Knave and the Peacock
author: celebros
summary: From the kinkmeme prompt: In the course of a conversation, Kip and Fitzroy fall into a bit of (initially joking, nonsexual) playacting where Fitzroy is the dastardly outlaw and Kip his helpless captive, until Fitzroy gets caught up in the role enough to steal a kiss. He's immediately appalled and apologetic, but it turns out Kip is really into it?

title: off the forest path
author: rattyjol
summary:
He thought of his Radiancy on the beach, quivering with need, and he thought of himself stepping forward—

"May I assist you, my lord?" His mouth curved around the shape of the words where he lay in his sunlit bed, and he shivered.

When Kip pulled me to the deck, I thought—

author: alfgifu

Cliopher doesn’t dream of kissing. Except once, after watching the Moon Lady attempt to seduce his Radiancy.

If he thought to mention that on the vaha, some things might have turned out very differently. Others, exactly the same.

Alternative title: Aurora, or: the Podcasts
Five Ystharan podcasts that never covered Nine Worlds characters or situations.

title: One Brilliant Glimpse
author: kerithwyn
summary:
“And then to that betrothal ball the Red Company came and gave me one brilliant glimpse of freedom.”
—Melissa Damara, The Hands of the Emperor

title: [podfic] in your eyes i see the morning

podfic of "in your eyes i see morning" by crownedrooster

Kip is tricked into drinking a truth serum on the morning of his second day as His Radiancy’s secretary.
Treason ensues.

title: check your house for radon
author: SicTransitVictoria
summary: When Cliopher offers a vacation, his Radiancy responds to it as the treason it is.

title: Delight
author: SunInGlory
summary:
Fitzroy gets a chance to take care of Kip in advance of the Jubilee. There is a lot of softness. Also - eventually - bubbles.

He grabbed Cliopher’s hand and tugged him towards the doorway leading to the Imperial Bath. “Now come, my dear. You’re about to be delighted.”

title: diving for a flame pearl
author: ariex09
summary:
It took me an appalling three hours and thirteen minutes to even realize that Kip was gone.

Ah, but that was too charitable. Once we had a timeline together, we discovered that Franzel had seen Kip last, turning in for bed at twelve minutes before midnight, and it was not until Shoänie went to wake him at dawn that anyone knew he was anything but asleep in bed. This meant that by the time the knock on my study door came, shortly past the third hour of the morning, Kip could already have been missing for more than nine hours.

-

In which Cliopher goes missing midway through The Hands of the Emperor. Fortunately, he has friends and family willing to do whatever it takes to bring him home.

title: A bit of comfort
author: SunInGlory
summary: In the aftermath of HR's heart attack, Cliopher gets an idea a bit sooner than in canon.

title: Dearly Beloved
author: Leah_The_Laudable
summary: A strange man crashes Their retirement party.

title: Time moves fast but we take it slow
author: fire_eyes_chica
summary:
written for the kink meme prompt: Cliopher is in the habit of bathing quickly and efficiently. Someone shows him how to take his time and enjoy it.

--

It's a lovely morning in the Vangavaye-ve. Ludvic helps his friend to appreciate it.

Pure fluff, no angst, just a nice moment between friends.

title: a small heist
author: ariex09
summary:
Cliopher didn’t know what he was nervous about, only that he was. He knew, though, that Tor had not forgotten that mossy cavern, the deepest part of the cave, any more than Cliopher had, so he wasn’t sure why —

He relaxed all the same when Tor said, “Oh!” and his whole face lit with a burst of merry mischief. “Is it time to plan a heist, Kip?”

Cliopher smiled back at him, helplessly, foolishly. “I thought — yes. If you still want to. It’s not a very impressive heist.”

title: A Tuesday Tea
author: PotatoStaresBackATTACK
summary: Jemis is unaware that for a long time now (since the cake competition) Roald and Mrs. Eraris have a weekly tea.

title: A shared song
author: alfgifu, breadandroses, rattyjol, Squeasel, SunInGlory
summary: An alternative version of Cliopher and Fitzroy's reunion in ATFOTS.

title: Keeping Promises
author: electropeach
summary:
The flow of time was still out of sync between Zunidh and Alinor; Cliopher had crossed over to Alinor two days before and made it to Stoneybridge only this morning, but it appeared to have been somewhat longer on Zunidh.

Enchanted notebooks help Kip and Fitzroy deal with Kip making a trip to Alinor.

title: The Recruit
author: Leah_The_Laudable
summary: There has been some suspicious activity down in Gorjo City. . .

title: Metamorphosis
author: rattyjol
summary:
"What is it?"

The boy peered eagerly around his tutor, who was inconsiderately blocking the view as he laid the strange bundle down on the settee. It was a very odd bundle, the boy thought, all sort of dangly, and with a small dark face peeping out the top.

"She's a child, chantling," said his tutor, arranging the bundle's... limbs, the boy supposed they must be, upon the cushions. "Like you."

title: A Woman of the Imperial House
author: kerithwyn
summary:
“[Lamissa] had taught me to submit to duty, for that was the most important lesson of all. And she had taught me, a woman of the Imperial House, what my primary duty would be—for Grand Duchess though I was destined to be, and now was, it was as Consort that I would be known.”
—Melissa Damara, The Hands of the Emperor

title: the long way home
author: ariex09
summary:
If Cliopher had to sit around twiddling his thumbs he would lose his mind. “I’m going to legalize the rest of Fitzroy Angursell’s poetry,” he said, without entirely meaning to. To Aioru’s widened eyes and Ludvic’s raised eyebrows, he said, “I need a project, it’s non-essential to government functioning, and he’s Zunidh’s poet laureate now. Having half of his works be illegal for sedition is absurd.”

-

A political crisis in Nijan prevents Cliopher from retiring after the landslide and reuniting with Fitzroy. What it can't prevent is Cliopher and Fitzroy being ridiculous about each other from worlds apart.

title: Cliopher Mdang and The Internet
author: tales_of_rhys
summary:
On a visit to Ysthar, Cliopher Mdang discovers the internet.

This goes exactly as one might expect.

summary:
A companion piece to my story, An Impossible Dream. This scene takes place during Chapter 8.

Conju and HR have a good talk while Cliopher sleeps.

title: a storm in yedoen
author: ariex09
summary:
The conversation remained light and cheerful until I said, “While I am quite pleased to see you, Rhodin, I will admit to some surprise that you are here. Everything is well at the palace, I trust?”

“Well would not precisely be the word I would use, my lord, but everything is perfectly under control, and there’s nothing you need worry about,” Rhodin assured me.

It is a great irony that few things are more worrying than someone assuring you, unprompted, that you have nothing to worry about.

-

In which Fitzroy meets up with Rhodin and receives some unwelcome news.

summary: In the wake of His Radiancy's heart attack, Ludvic Omo holds his hand.

author: SunInGlory
summary: During ATFOTS, Ludvic takes a sky ship to the Vangavaye-ve to see Cliopher and Fitzroy.

title: [podfic] bright eyes
author: AudioSilks (WhenasInSilks)
summary:
podfic of "bright eyes" by crownedrooster

You closed your eyes, just for a moment, and gestured for them to open the door. You could face this; you must.
Cliopher sayo Mdang was not there.

Or: Cliopher doesn’t show up the morning after he met the Emperor’s eyes.

title: one of the most perfectly splendid mornings
author: resplendeo
summary:
On vacation at Navikiani, His Radiancy — the Sun-On-Earth, the Lord Magus of Zunidh, and the holder of perhaps countless other titles — tries his best to reach out and connect with the members of his household.

It's hard, but it's worth doing.

summary: A quiet dinner between friends, one Silverheart long after the fall.
