summary:
Little bird, where are you going?
Would you mind if I came too?
I thought I had it all together
But then I saw your lovely colors

title: Five Confused Shells
author: WerewolvesAreReal
summary:
Zunidh still suffers from people slipping through time and space. At least this visit is brief, albeit perplexing.

Not perplexing for Fitzroy; just for the visitors.

title: Small Joys
author: WerewolvesAreReal
summary: Several months after taking Cliopher Mdang as his secretary, the Lord of Rising Stars comes to a startling conclusion: Cliopher actually enjoys paperwork.

title: pacemaker
author: iniquiticity
summary: Ludvic was accustomed to pretending to be distant to the smell of Rhodin, but he did not have to be now. He knelt in front of Rhodin, Rhodin's wrist in his hand, because Rhodin had expressed an interest (attempted to be cool about but Ludvic knew exactly what it looked like when he wanted to jump out of his skin with excitement) about Ludvic drinking his blood.

title: Mischief and Marigolds
author: fire_eyes_chica
summary:
There are many holidays on Zunidh and sometimes Cliopher forgets what they are. Fortunately, the junior secretaries are there to remind him.

 

Just a fun little ficlet to celebrate Halloween and spooky season.

title: By Any Other Name
author: WerewolvesAreReal
summary:
His Radiancy names Cliopher Mdang the ‘Hands of the Emperor’ – a title usually reserved for consorts. But the Ouranatha assure them it will include no harmful or binding effects upon Sayo Mdang whatsoever.

The Ouranatha, of course, lie.

title: Faced Against the Sun
author: WerewolvesAreReal
summary:
Cliopher meets another Islander in Solaara, a mage of the Ela. They start dating.
When things get difficult, though, he finds he can't discuss it with his friends - or warn his Radiancy about the movements of the Ouranatha.

title: Last-Minute Instructions
author: electropeach
summary: Fitzroy catches Cliopher leaving some last-minute instructions before his trip.

title: some we light on fire
author: crownedrooster
summary:
“I have come to realise that I could create slack in the chains that are shackling me to the throne. I was deemed a great poet once, a folk hero capable of illuminating the darkest corners of the human soul with his stories and his wit. My imagination is badly atrophied but with Cliopher at my side, I have felt it slowly awaken, and I have been applying it to solve a critical issue: how I can pleasure my beloved secretary without once touching his skin.

I have found the possibilities to be far greater than I expected.”

title: Humming Aurora
author: DontStopHerNow
summary: Everyone knows it, and so far no one has figured out how to ban the melody itself.

title: familiar faces
author: rattyjol
summary: On a visit to Ysthar, Fitzroy and Kip have a realization.

title: Family Visits
author: WerewolvesAreReal
summary:
A god visits Solaara.

Also, Cliopher gets to see his uncle! The one married to Tovo; it’s weird that Cliopher can’t recall his name. And everyone is being a bit funny about his visitor...

title: a curious streak of good fortune
author: crownedrooster
summary: The Lord Chancellor of Zunidh is having an unusually (one might even say suspiciously) perfect day.

title: Golden banners
author: alfgifu
summary:
The emperor of Astandalas has a great banner wrought of fairy silk.

The fae want it back, now that the empire has fallen.

They might, perhaps, have miscalculated. But they have brought strange magics, and the only way the Last Emperor can protect his household - is with a kiss.

title: fool's gold
author: ariex09
summary:
“Will you tell me what’s bothering you so, Kip?” his Radiancy murmured.

“It’s nothing,” Cliopher said, and then to the unwavering, unimpressed look, amended it to, “It’s foolish.”

His Radiancy countered that with a singular raised eyebrow.

“You won’t like it,” Cliopher confessed, and closed his eyes.

-

In the aftermath of a long and weird week, Cliopher has an unusual favor to ask of his Radiancy.

title: The Shadow of a Bridge is Deep
author: PotatoStaresBackATTACK
summary:
Kip gasped, sitting up too fast, a hitch in his heart, a drop in his gut—he’d fallen?
Yes. He’d been in the Grey Mountains. The men chasing him with spears. The bridge under his feet. A shout, and then he’d fallen—
“Kip,” the voice drew near enough that it sparked against his mind, against his soul, a sound as bright as a light that had once called—

title: Hazards of Duty
author: WerewolvesAreReal
summary:
Someone tries to kill Cliopher. And then someone else tries to kill Cliopher. And then a few (dozen) more people.
Also, Quintus chooses an awful time to visit.

title: This Isn't Alinor
author: Leah_The_Laudable
summary: Tiny Drabble. Zaoul and the Council of Princes.

title: Compulsion
author: neverloseyou
summary:
"I must ask you not to resist,” Rhodin said miserably.
Cliopher went very still. What was he feeling? His reaction to Rhodin’s words certainly ought to have been more negative than it felt, than the tiny shiver running through his body. Perhaps it was just that he did trust him, quite literally, with his life.
“I’m guessing that sounded about as bad as I thought it would,” Rhodin said after a moment.
Cliopher cleared his throat again before speaking. “Not at all,” he finally said. “I was just–thinking. You have my full cooperation,” he continued, as if they were endeavoring to begin some interdepartmental project together.
Rhodin breathed in deeply. He was so very close, so close to touching. “You’re not afraid,” he said.
“No,” Cliopher said simply. “Concerned, obviously. But I am not afraid of you, Rhodin, nor of what you might do to me tonight.”

title: Two Royal Pardons
author: WerewolvesAreReal
summary:
After they dissolve the Office of Censorship, Cliopher insists his Radiancy pardon Fitzroy Angursell.
His lord refuses.

title: kaamos
author: electropeach
summary:
Elonoa'a sailed to the stars for his dearest friend. I have destroyed the world for mine.

 

A HotE era AU in which the Lord of Zunidh's reaction to the death of his Hands has devastating consequences.

title: Fire Sermon
author: WhenasInSilks
summary: In your dreams, Cliopher always burns.

title: the midnight hours
author: ariex09
summary:
“I’m dreaming, and dreaming about you, that’s all,” Cliopher informed me. “For one, I don’t believe in fate, or destiny. Second of all, you’re dressed like Fitzroy Angursell, and that’s clearly not right.” Oh, but this really was dangerous, for you and for me. “Third of all, if this is real I’m probably going to get executed tomorrow for the really very egregious etiquette violations I’ve already committed, and I would prefer not to be.”

“Nobody’s executing you,” you said sharply. You were not going to let anyone. Not Cliopher Mdang, your competent, intrepid, unpolished secretary. (Your soulmate.)

“You see?” Cliopher said. “Unrealistic. Definitely a dream.”

-

A Petty Treasons-era soulmates AU.

title: Protocol 2, Subsection B, Appendix 3
author: notanotherpseudonym
summary: Protocol for the Unexpected Death of the Lord Chancellor of Zunidh, Subsection B: Death due to assassination or other work-related incident. Appendix 3: Personal letters.

title: The Sun Sets Low
author: rattyjol
summary: Cliopher had only to look at my face; he knew me. "That's it, then," he said, as if it were simple. In the end, I suppose, it was.

title: A still more golden blaze
author: fire_eyes_chica
summary:
“I hear,” Ludvic said presently, “that Conju invited you to go with him to finish off his vacation, and you said no.”

Cliopher looked down at the scarred wood of the tabletop. Conju had invited him, casually but also sincerely. Now that he was caught up on Cliopher’s mother’s gossip—or so he put it—Conju was ready to return to his extravagant and meticulously planned holiday, Antonio or no Antonio, and make the most of it.

 

What would happen if Cliopher had decided to accompany Conju on his vacation after all? What would weeks of sensual pampering and romantic dinners between friends lead to?

title: Coffee lips
author: fire_eyes_chica
summary:
Cliopher Mdang keeps a lovely cafe that welcomes anyone from the community looking for a place to belong. That includes the charming street musician who plays outside his front window almost every day.

Now if only he could figure out the musician's favorite drink...

title: Devotion
author: aunt_zelda
summary:
He knew, before he moved, before he acted, that he would die for it.

Yet still he moved. Still he acted. There was no question, no hesitation, no instant of doubt.

title: Tell it like it is
author: SunInGlory
summary:
"And what—" said his Radiancy, raising a brow. "—does that mean?"

"It means you should make an honest man out of your secretary," the Grand Duchess of Damara—his Radiancy's sister, Melissa—said. "The man needs protection only you can give."

Cliopher managed not to drop his pen, although he did drop a ridiculously large glob of ink onto his notepaper for the first time in well over a decade. He didn't—couldn't—say a word. It wasn't his place and, even if it were, his mind was a complete blank.

title: Coming Home
author: SunInGlory
summary:
He felt like the ghost of a ghost—unreal, a shadow. He shivered, watching, wanting to curl himself away from the intensity of life surrounding him. Flowers blooming. Birds singing. People calling out greetings to each other, no hint of distress or weariness or fear in their voices.

He didn't look up; he couldn’t. He didn’t want to catch anyone’s eye, to feel the weight of their judgement, to be recognized.

--

After his long journey, Kip makes it home.

title: Hidden Depths
author: SunInGlory
summary:
“I would like to give Cliopher a gift,” I told my Groom of the Chamber. “I would appreciate it greatly if you were willing to help with it.”

“Of course, my lord,” Conju agreed without hesitation. “What kind of a gift? I’d be happy to procure it for you.”

HR wants to give Cliopher a gift, but he needs Conju's help to make it happen.

title: Embers by alfgifu [Podfic]
author: Rhea314 (Rhea)
summary:
Kip Mdang returns to Solaara, hardly confident that the Imperial Service will take him back but sure that there is no place for him in the Vangavaye-ve.

The City of Cities is still expanding from the backwater village it was before the Fall; the work of reconstruction continues but it is no longer a simple crisis. In the Palace the big political beasts are circling for position under the newly awakened Emperor.

Despondent and determined to bury himself in work, Cliopher finds his former patron disapproving and the new Master of Offices openly hostile. But he is still a fifth degree secretary, and some problems are easier to solve when you feel that you have little left to lose... and don't care which enemies you make along the way.

title: The Sun of This World
author: WerewolvesAreReal
summary:
“I am afraid I do not know that law,” says Ludvic, even.
“Of course; it mandates that any woman of the royal house must be married before having a child, or else face execution for treason.”

title: mentorship
author: iniquiticity
summary:
Rhodin had never looked at him like that, the way he looked at anyone at court, the way he sometimes looked at Conju when Conju wasn’t looking. Ludvic had contented himself with that lack. It would be complicated, after all. He did not at all need it the way it seemed like others did. He never asked - that was not the shape of their relationship.

 

(Based on this unhinged AO3 prompt: "When your 'friend' tenderly taking care of your wounds gives you a raging hard-on.")

title: tasted light but fed the dark
author: crownedrooster
summary:
“I don't care about what you want,” an Vilius snapped. “He's my best friend. He's family.” Anger was gleaming in his eyes. “And you broke his heart.”

Or: the Cavalier an Vilius and Fitzroy Angursell have a difficult conversation.

title: Breathe
author: electropeach
summary: Cliopher is injured during an adventure; Fitzroy copes poorly. Mutual comforting and caring follows.

title: to be the servant underneath
author: Anonymous
summary:
"And so you sought me out," says Conju, now stalking forwards, voice lowering to a hum. "Wearing your state of ruin for all to see."

"No," Ludvic says simply, allowing Conju to come close. "Just you."

What can you find at the intersection between duty and desire and Commander Ludvic Omo's kilt?

title: say I'm doing just fine
author: ariex09
summary:
Cliopher saw it the moment he stepped into the clearing.

His Radiancy had not described the creature that stole his memories at any point to Cliopher. Still, Cliopher looked at the winged creature before him, its head slowly tilting from side to side, forked tongue flickering through its lips as if to taste the air, and he knew.

The creature hissed, “What is it that you want?”

It was a little irritating that everybody had been right to insist that Cliopher go nowhere alone while they’d still been hunting for his Radiancy’s memories.

-

Or, three encounters Cliopher has with the creature after Fitzroy gets his memories back.

“Where am I?” he asked. “Who are you? How did I come here?”

“My name is Christine Chapel,” she said, “I’m a nurse aboard the Starship Enterprise.” She gestured around to the room and, he inferred, the wider structure of wherever this was. “As for how you got here, we were hoping you could tell us! From our perspective, it looked like you fell out of thin air.”

Not again, he thought but did not say.

Hiscaron is happy as a Palace Guard. Minimum drama, minimum fuss, maximum standing about with well-oiled muscles on display in front of potential paramours.

The Emperor's new secretary is not cooperating with this career plan.

“It’s a letter to the Offices of State’s public communications box,” Rhodin said. “With an anecdote about the annual stipend.”

“Is it?” Cliopher said. They got plenty of those letters, of course; usually reading and responding to them was the first-year secretaries’ job. “And it made its way to you?”

“Well,” Rhodin said blithely, “it claims to be from Fitzroy Angursell, you see.”

-

title: Emperor!Kip: The Red Book Letters

As Cliopher struggles with loss and an inheritance he never wanted, he has to find a way to move forward so that he can fulfill his Radiancy’s last request: to make life better for the people of Zunidh.

“Well,” said Viorin, “you heard about the latest Imperial Secretary, right?”

Emilia groaned “What happened to this one?” The short and calamitous careers of the various unfortunate souls sent up to trial as secretaries to the Glorious One was a running - and not at all funny - joke across the Palace.

Viorin grinned at her. “You are out of the loop! This one’s made it stick, somehow,” she said, “he’s been there for months now, and he’s working with the Dragon on a total reform of all the Ministries, with the Emperor’s support, and word has it that the Ouranatha are out on their ears, and General Ravillon’s retiring, and they ordered Merry’s arrest.”

title: your place in the family of things
author: ariex09
summary:
My dear Kip,

Letters are an infuriating medium at times. Not that I can deny their value and their advantageousness, and of course it is better to be able to hear from you at all, when I am worlds away. But I wish that you were still only a floor below mine, that I could steal down to your apartments and see if you were awake, invite you to go on a walk in the gardens with me or play a game of draughts or just sit quietly with you, where I could read at least some of the currents of your heart and mind in your face and your posture, where you could take one look at me and see that I am brimming, overflowing with a thousand contradictory feelings and impulses without my needing to find the words.

Not, of course, that I was ever brave enough to do such a thing back when you were so close.

-

Seven letters from Fitzroy that did not pass through the enchanted letter tray.

()

Eritanyr’s Golden Queen - Xanthippi, her name was Xanthippi - let out a bugling clarion call, and jerked my attention away from my Helene.

Xanthippi dropped her head to meet my eyes, amused despite her pain, despite everything.

Artorin Damara, she said. I always thought it would be you.

“Kip,” I said, and my voice came out tight. “Did a piece of glass hit you? Here, let me—” and I reached around to check the wound. If the glass had nicked him that was one thing, but if it had—had punctured—

But it wasn’t a piece of glass at all. It took me a moment, my fingers meeting Kip’s, trembling and wet with blood, over the objected embedded in his side, to realize what it was.

It was a dart.

Let me tell you of outstanding beauty!
Of light, and love, and stolen hearts!
A night we soared beyond the sky
and from this world we did depart!
Of the highs we had and loves we found
when the Moon led us through her silvered lair.
I tell you of this place and time
and the adventures we encountered there!
From our realm to hers she bade us go
where the limnal shades in silver glow.

Kissing the Moon is Fitzroy Angursell's second-most well-known poetry cycle, after Aurora. This is how that second-best-known cycle begins.

title: A worn line, etched into the floor
author: SunInGlory
summary:
Based on the Bingo Prompt: Kip and Pali have it out

“How could you sit there for a thousand years watching him wear a line into the floor and do nothing?” Pali Avramapul didn’t yell but her latest accusation stung far worse for its quiet yet caustic, not quite whispered words. “You, who purport to love him more than anyone.”

“Not anyone,” he interrupted, knowing it for truth. As much as he loved his fanoa, he was well aware others did too—including the woman standing before him.

She gave him a scathing look, as if his admission was yet another fault in her eyes.

Based on the Bingo Prompt: Fitzroy finds out that Kip thought he might be executed after Pali’s visit

“You thought I would have you executed?” I asked quietly.

The serenity was in my voice, the emotionless calm I’d affected as the Sun-on-Earth, the Lord of Rising Stars, the Last Emperor of Astandalas. I couldn’t help it—not here, not in the place where I’d kept my emotions and instinctive responses as harshly captive as the taboos and rituals and expectations of my position had kept me.

I’d failed only once since the first few weeks of my reign. Once.

title: An inglorious afternoon in the private study
author: SunInGlory
summary:
“What did you eat this morning, my lord?” Kip asked—not quite pointedly, but close.

I heaved again, trying not to let my dismay show. This was not how I’d planned to spend our afternoon together. I’d asked him into my private study to teach me how to greet people. Instead, he’d spent most of the time sitting at my feet holding a waste basket.
